tweets.html:
I wish TCA Awards voting hadn’t ended already. #Sharknado

— Jason Lynch (@jasonlynch) July 12, 2013

Spoiler: Bob Benson was Sharknado all along.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) July 12, 2013

"Why is there a retirement home next to an airport?" "Because old people can't hear?" ACTUAL DIALOGUE! #Sharknado

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) July 12, 2013

#SharkNado sounds like an excellent breakfast opportunity.

— Sharktopus (@SharktopusLives) July 12, 2013

.@DalaiLama turn on your tv, there's a tornado with sharks inside it #sharknado

— Matt Fowler (@TheMattFowler) July 12, 2013

"Today we are CANCELLING the #Sharknado!" --Idris Elba, in my dreams tonight

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) July 12, 2013

ON THE NEXT #SHARKNADO: [Shark drinks whiskey.] Shark: "What happened?" [Shark answers phone pensively.] [Shark drinks gin.]

— Andy (@AndyDaglas) July 12, 2013

Wow, #Sharknado really makes you think. It makes you think "Why am I watching this shit?"

— Justin Stangel (@Justin_Stangel) July 12, 2013

I saw the best minds of my generation live tweet Sharknado.

— Alison Forns (@alisonforns) July 12, 2013

It's fun to add #Sharknado to non-Sharknado tweets RT @CNN: Pope Francis lays down the law on child sex abuse on Vatican grounds. #Sharknado

— Morgan Murphy (@morgan_murphy) July 12, 2013

Tomorrow, GOP will introduce Sharknado Prevention and Preparedness Act of 2013, which repeals Obamacare and restricts reproductive health.

— pourmecoffee (@pourmecoffee) July 12, 2013

Most of Tara Reid's acting decisions boil down to her looking in vain for Craft Services. #Sharknado

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) July 12, 2013

@weatherchannel It's a little embarrassing that I have to learn about sharknados from @Syfy

— Schuyler Patterson• (@TillOwlglass) July 12, 2013

I’d hate to be premiering a fun, hip, made for twitter fun show against Sharknado…oh, hi, Hollywood Game Night…

— David J. Loehr (@dloehr) July 12, 2013

"Your son wants to go drop a bomb into a tornado." "No, too dangerous!" #helicopterparenting

— Emily Nussbaum (@emilynussbaum) July 12, 2013

Not watching it, but already can't wait for the Sharknado spoof, Terrence Malick's Knight of Cups.

— Richard Lawson (@rilaws) July 12, 2013

Every cable company in the country should thank the @Syfy channel for giving us a reason to watch live television again. #Sharknado #noDVR

her grandfather was a shark

— BUM CHILLUPS (@edsbs) July 12, 2013

Dear @SyfyTV: please follow up SHARKNADO with PARTLY CLOWNY. Sky. Clowns. Michael Pare (probably)

— Patton Oswalt (@pattonoswalt) July 12, 2013

RT @realdonaldtrump Sharks are devastating the west coast and Obama is doing nothing. #Loser #Sharknado

— Crutnacker (@Crutnacker) July 12, 2013

Sharks-ate-my-grandfather is the new I-grew-up-in-a-whorehouse.

— Emily Nussbaum (@emilynussbaum) July 12, 2013

#Sharknado Six men went into the water, one little girl came out, the sharks took the rest.

Anyway, we delivered the bomb.

— Thunder Levin (@ThunderLevin) July 12, 2013

I'm not sure you need a tragic backstory to hate a shark-filled tornado. #Sharknado begs to differ with me.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) July 12, 2013

It’s going to be so cathartic when she battles and kills the same shark who ate her grandfather

— James Poniewozik (@poniewozik) July 12, 2013

My favorite exchange of the day. pic.twitter.com/g93dwZj5mJ

This movie ends with Tara Reid announcing she's pregnant with a shark baby as she shoots her own son right? right? #Sharknado

— brian (@AdmiraltyPirate) July 12, 2013

SHARKNADO is secretly the most scathing indictment of the American education system ever.

— Ryan Nanni (@celebrityhottub) July 12, 2013

ScyFy Channel totally 'nadoed the shark.

— Miles Kahn (@mileskahn) July 12, 2013

Season 4 of The Newsroom will deal extensively with the Los Angeles Sharknado disaster. #sharknado

— Matt Fowler (@TheMattFowler) July 12, 2013

It will be oh-so-appropriate if #Sharknado is the Twitter Generation's "Roots."

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) July 12, 2013

Oh, no. She did NOT just say "We're gonna need a bigger chopper," and in a way that was completely nonsensical, did she? #SHARKNADO

— Alan Sepinwall (@sepinwall) July 12, 2013

“Oh crap. Look at all those sharks!” was an actual line spoken by an actual person in actual movie that I am watching. #Sharknado

— Tony Bleach (@acbleach) July 12, 2013

If this works we should probably tell people in Oklahoma that we found a way to stop tornados #Sharknado

— brian (@AdmiraltyPirate) July 12, 2013

tweets.html:
Define "missing" RT @MJMcKean: Am I really missing a movie called Sharknado?

— Eric Goldman Likes the Star Wars (@TheEricGoldman) July 12, 2013

Can't wait for the sequel SHARKNADO 2: 2SHARK2NADO

— Collin Simmons (@CollinColeman) July 12, 2013

I haven't seen this many tweets about a TV show since In Treatment, HE SAID DISINGENUOUSLY AND BITTERLY! #SharkNado

— Marvel's Infinity Waco (@johnwarrender) July 12, 2013

@brayingdixon @Ebradley127 This footage is amazing. How did they get the sharks to do all this? #SharkNado

— Glen Mazzara (@glenmazzara) July 12, 2013

#SHARKNADO I still don't know why we blew up the pool, but it was in the script, so why not! We haven't blown up enough stuff at this point!

tweets.author_name: Wil 'Kick the Nazis off the tweeters' Wheaton
tweets.html:
"We lost the night to #SharkNado? What the hell is that?" - every non-syfy network executive tomorrow morning.

— Wil 'Kick the Nazis off the tweeters' Wheaton (@wilw) July 12, 2013

To be fair, it is the most realistic sharknado I've ever seen.

— (((Josh))) (@Tyrangiel) July 12, 2013

@DamonLindelof Write me a role as a plucky but wise cracking Aussie shark wrangler, and I'm in. Bad accent & everything.

— Elizabeth Banks (@ElizabethBanks) July 12, 2013

@DamonLindelof was she born w harpoon arm or is it the result of an agricultural accident on family farm? Just starting my preparation.

— Elizabeth Banks (@ElizabethBanks) July 12, 2013

@DamonLindelof I mean I am all for harpoon arm, I just want it to be relatable and grounded and not feel too "stunty."

— Elizabeth Banks (@ElizabethBanks) July 12, 2013

@DamonLindelof did Tessa already take revenge on the guy who harpooned mom or am I dating his son in #sharknado2 #backstory

— Elizabeth Banks (@ElizabethBanks) July 12, 2013

Dammit...I forgot to watch the first broadcast of SHARKNADO. It feels like missing the moon landing.

— Jeffrey Sconce (@JeffreySconce) July 12, 2013

"He pulls a hammerhead, you pull a great white. That's the Chicago way. That's how you get Sharknado." -Ian Ziering

Tara Reid doesn't look bad for fifty. #Sharknado

— Crutnacker (@Crutnacker) July 12, 2013

This girl is gonna have a very fucked up college essay.

Ian zeiring just chainsawed his way out of a sharks anus. #Sharknado Great movie.

If that is not the proudest moment of Ian Ziering's career, he's been living his life wrong. #sharknado

"And THAT'S how I met your shark mother." #Sharknado

I could write a thousand tweets and never have enough words to sum up the brilliance of what just happened there. #SHARKNADO

My God this movie is basically 82 straight minutes worth of GIFs.

From the Sharknado we die, from the Sharknado we are born… #message #sharknado

This is now like #Enlightened, but with sharks instead of turtles. #Sharknado

"Of the sharks in all the towns in all the world, she jumps into mine." Ian Ziering in #Sharknado

/Randy Travis stumbles out of shark's belly

Siri, can a sharknado happen in England?

That, and I mean this as a compliment, was a movie entirely worthy of the name SHARKNADO.

.@DamonLindelof Why are you wasting time Tweeting me? Already starting my draft! #Sharknado

No one in public broadcasting will now look for their own version of Sharknado. And they should. And hell yes I'm serious.

Somewhat alarmed that SHARKNADO has brought more unity to my twitter feed than any previous cause, movement, or event.

and now everyone there is going around cheering and dancing and shouting "the network is saved!", anyways, that's what i like to imagine.

Sharknado is everything that is right AND wrong about everything.

It's made of #shark and #nado.

LEMURCANE

If Oscar Wilde were only alive in the age of Twitter.... I bet he'd have funny shit to say about Sharknado.

Pause.

Tara Reid: How bout I play blank?
